paper_title: Sulfur doped In2O3-CeO2 hollow hexagonal prisms with carbon coating for efficient photocatalytic CO2 reduction

catalyst.source: Benefiting from these advantages, the obtained optimized S-C/In 2 O 3 -CeO 2 HHP exhibits superior gas phase photocatalytic performance for the conversion of CO 2 into CH 4 and CO, yielding a CH 4 yield of 60.6 mol g -1 h -1 and a selectivity of 92.4 under AM1.5 irradiation without noble metal and organic photosensitizer.
catalyst.context: Developing integrated photocatalysts with advanced structures and desired components is an effective strategy for promoting solar-to-chemical energy conversion.Herein, a novel sulfur-doped In 2 O 3 -CeO 2 hollow hexagonal prism with a thin carbon coating (S-C/In 2 O 3 -CeO 2 HHP) is synthesized by directly pyrolyzing Ce-doped In-Materials of Institute Lavoisier-68 (In-MIL-68) hexagonal prism metal-organic frameworks under N 2 atmosphere in the presence of sulfur powder, showing excellent photocatalytic carbon dioxide (CO 2 ) reduction efficiency.This synthetic strategy realizes the regulation of structure, components, and surface defects of the final products.The synergistic effects of hollow porous hexagonal prism structure, In 2 O 3 -CeO 2 heterojunction, and surface defects exhibit advantageous features for CO 2 photoreactions with accelerated transfer and separation of charge carriers, enhanced visible-light utilization and CO 2 chemisorption ability, and enlarged catalytic active sites.Benefiting from these advantages, the obtained optimized S-C/In 2 O 3 -CeO 2 HHP exhibits superior gas phase photocatalytic performance for the conversion of CO 2 into CH 4 and CO, yielding a CH 4 yield of 60.6 mol g -1 h -1 and a selectivity of 92.4 under AM1.5 irradiation without noble metal and organic photosensitizer.This work presents a strategy for the rational design and fabrication of efficient photocatalysts with advanced hollow architectures.

catalyst.context: In summary, we have rationally designed and prepared sulfur doped In 2 O 3 -CeO 2 hollow hexagonal prism-shaped photocatalyst with a thin carbon coating through the synthesis of Ce-doped In-MIL-68 hexagonal prisms and subsequent pyrolysis process in the presence of sulfur powder.The carbon-coated hollow porous hexagonal prism composites hold unique structural and component features with various favorable properties.The introduction of CeO 2 nanoparticles and carbon layer facilitate the charge transfer and separation, and therefore improve the gas-phase photocatalytic CO 2 reduction activity.The multiple reflections in the hollow porous hexagonal prisms provide more active sites, high light utilization, and fast mass transport of reactants/products.Meanwhile, the oxygen vacancy related surface defects can further improve these advantages.Consequently, the synergetic catalytic effect of these benefits enable the optimized hybird catalyst to exhibit remarkable CH 4 yield rate (60.6 mol g -1 h -1 ) and high selectivity (92.4) with outstanding stability.This work provides rational guidelines for architecture design and compositional control of hybrid catalysts to improve solar energy utilization and conversion efficiencies. light source.context: The Ce-doped In-MIL-68 precursors with various Ce/In ratios (the molar ratios of the Ce and In are 1:20, 1:10, and 1:5) were synthesized using the modified method 44.Typically, 60 mg of In(NO 3 ) 3 4.5H 2 O, certain amounts of Ce(NO 3 ) 3 6H 2 O (e.g., 3.5, 7, and 14 mg), 60 mg of 1,4-benzenedicarboxylic acid, and 40 mL of N, N-Dimethylformamide were added in a three-necked bottle, followed by stirring for 2 min.Then, the three-necked bottle was kept at 120 C for 30 min in an oil bath.After the reaction, the product was washed with ethanol several times. To synthesize sulfur(S)-doped In 2 O 3 -CeO 2 hollow hexagonal prisms with a carbon coating, the prepared Ce-doped In-MIL-68 hexagonal prism precursors and sulfur powder (mass ratio of 1:2) were thoroughly blended in a porcelain boat and heated to 500 C for 2 h with a heating rate of 5 C min -1 under an N 2 atmosphere.The products prepared from 3.5, 7, and 14 mg of Ce(NO 3 ) 3 6H 2 O were designated as S-C/In 2 O 3 -CeO 2 -1/2 HHP, S-C/In 2 O 3 -CeO 2 HHP, and S-C/In 2 O 3 -CeO 2 -2 HHP.For comparison, some control samples were also prepared as follows: In 2 O 3 hollow hexagonal prisms were prepared via the following route: In-MIL-68 hexagonal prisms precursor was heated to 500 C and kept for 2 h with a heating rate of 5 C min -1 in air atmosphere.The obtained product was designated as In 2 O 3 HHP. Carbon-coated In 2 O 3 hexagonal prisms were prepared under the same reaction conditions without the introduction of Ce 3 and sulfur powder.The obtained product was designated as C/In 2 O 3 HP. Sulfur(S)-doped In 2 O 3 hollow hexagonal prisms with carbon coating were also prepared under the same reaction conditions without the introduction of Ce 3 .The product obtained was designated as S-C/In 2 O HHP. Carbon-coated In 2 O 3 -CeO 2 hexagonal prisms were prepared using the same synthetic condition without the introduction of sulfur powder.The product obtained was designated as C/In 2 O 3 -CeO 2 HP. In 2 O 3 -CeO 2 hollow hexagonal prisms were prepared by annealing Ce-doped In-MIL-68 hexagonal prisms precursor in an air atmosphere at the same pyrolysis temperature.The product obtained was designated as In 2 O 3 -CeO 2 HHP. S-In 2 O 3 -CeO 2 hollow hexagonal prisms were also prepared under the same reaction conditions of S-C/In 2 O 3 -CeO 2 HHP using In 2 O 3 -CeO hollow hexagonal prisms to replace Ce-doped In-MIL-68 precursors. CeO 2 was also prepared via the following steps: First, Ce-based metal-organic framework precursor was prepared.70 mg Ce (NO 3 ) 3 6H 2 O, 60 mg of 1,4-benzenedicarboxylic acid, and 40 mL of N, N-Dimethylformamide were added in a three-necked bottle, followed by stirring for 2 min.Then, the three-necked bottle was kept at 120 C for min in an oil bath.After the reaction, the product was washed with ethanol several times.Finally, the Ce-based metal-organic framework precursor was heated to 500 C and kept for 2 h with a heating rate of 5 C min -1 in air atmosphere. S-C/CeO 2 was also prepared by annealing the Ce-based metal--organic framework precursor at 500 C for 2 h an N 2 atmosphere in the presence of Sulfur powder. The morphology and structurs were examined by Sigma 500 scanning electron microscope (SEM), JEM-F200 transmission electron microscopy (TEM), and SmartLab X-ray diffractometer (XRD, 9 KW, CuKa radiation).X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS) was implemented on a Kratos-AXISUL TRA DLD spectroscopy.UV-vis diffuse reflectance spectra were acquired on an Lambda 950 UV-vis spectrophotometer (Perkin-Elmer).The photoluminescence (PL) spectra were obtained on a FLS920P fluorescence system (Edinburgh).The N 2 adsorption-desorption isotherms were acquired on an ASAP 2420 adsorption apparatus micrometer.CO 2 adsorption curves were acquired on a micromeritics instrument (Autosorb-iQ, Quantachrome) at 273 K.In situ Fourier-transform infrared (FTIR) spectra were acquired from infrared spectrometer (Nicolet IS-50) with an in situ Harrick IR cell.CO temperature-programmed desorption tests were performed on an automated chemisorption analyzer (ChemBET Pulsar Quantachrome) with a thermal conductivity detector (TCD). Photocurrent response, electrochemical impedance, and Mott-Schottky plots were obtained on a BAS100B electrochemical workstation in the 0.1 M Na 2 SO 4 electrolyte solution under illumination of a 300 W Xe lamp with an AM 1.5 filter.Saturated calomel electrode and Platinum wire were used as the reference electrode and counter electrode, respectively. In a typical CO 2 photoreduction system, a gas-solid reactor (80 mL, PLS-SXE300, Perfect light, China) was used.5 mg photocatalyst powder was evenly spread on a glass sheet (1.5 cm 2.5 cm).Then the reactor was purged with CO 2 gas (99.999) for 60 min through deionized water under ambient pressure.Then the reactor was exposed to the Xe lamp (300 W) with an AM1.5 filter, and the light intensity of the light source was adjusted to 100 mW cm -2 using a NREL-calibrated Si solar cell.Cooling water circulation was applied to keep the reactor at 25 C.After every 1 h of reaction, 1 mL gas was sampled from reactor and quantified with GC7900 gas chromatograph. 13CO 2 (Beijing Gaisi Chemical Gases Company) was used to detect carbon source on the Agilent 6890 N/ 5973 N GC-MS analyzer.

reaction medium.context: Developing integrated photocatalysts with advanced structures and desired components is an effective strategy for promoting solar-to-chemical energy conversion.Herein, a novel sulfur-doped In 2 O 3 -CeO 2 hollow hexagonal prism with a thin carbon coating (S-C/In 2 O 3 -CeO 2 HHP) is synthesized by directly pyrolyzing Ce-doped In-Materials of Institute Lavoisier-68 (In-MIL-68) hexagonal prism metal-organic frameworks under N 2 atmosphere in the presence of sulfur powder, showing excellent photocatalytic carbon dioxide (CO 2 ) reduction efficiency.This synthetic strategy realizes the regulation of structure, components, and surface defects of the final products.The synergistic effects of hollow porous hexagonal prism structure, In 2 O 3 -CeO 2 heterojunction, and surface defects exhibit advantageous features for CO 2 photoreactions with accelerated transfer and separation of charge carriers, enhanced visible-light utilization and CO 2 chemisorption ability, and enlarged catalytic active sites.Benefiting from these advantages, the obtained optimized S-C/In 2 O 3 -CeO 2 HHP exhibits superior gas phase photocatalytic performance for the conversion of CO 2 into CH 4 and CO, yielding a CH 4 yield of 60.6 mol g -1 h -1 and a selectivity of 92.4 under AM1.5 irradiation without noble metal and organic photosensitizer.This work presents a strategy for the rational design and fabrication of efficient photocatalysts with advanced hollow architectures.

reactor type.context: The Ce-doped In-MIL-68 precursors with various Ce/In ratios (the molar ratios of the Ce and In are 1:20, 1:10, and 1:5) were synthesized using the modified method 44.Typically, 60 mg of In(NO 3 ) 3 4.5H 2 O, certain amounts of Ce(NO 3 ) 3 6H 2 O (e.g., 3.5, 7, and 14 mg), 60 mg of 1,4-benzenedicarboxylic acid, and 40 mL of N, N-Dimethylformamide were added in a three-necked bottle, followed by stirring for 2 min.Then, the three-necked bottle was kept at 120 C for 30 min in an oil bath.After the reaction, the product was washed with ethanol several times. To synthesize sulfur(S)-doped In 2 O 3 -CeO 2 hollow hexagonal prisms with a carbon coating, the prepared Ce-doped In-MIL-68 hexagonal prism precursors and sulfur powder (mass ratio of 1:2) were thoroughly blended in a porcelain boat and heated to 500 C for 2 h with a heating rate of 5 C min -1 under an N 2 atmosphere.The products prepared from 3.5, 7, and 14 mg of Ce(NO 3 ) 3 6H 2 O were designated as S-C/In 2 O 3 -CeO 2 -1/2 HHP, S-C/In 2 O 3 -CeO 2 HHP, and S-C/In 2 O 3 -CeO 2 -2 HHP.For comparison, some control samples were also prepared as follows: In 2 O 3 hollow hexagonal prisms were prepared via the following route: In-MIL-68 hexagonal prisms precursor was heated to 500 C and kept for 2 h with a heating rate of 5 C min -1 in air atmosphere.The obtained product was designated as In 2 O 3 HHP. Carbon-coated In 2 O 3 hexagonal prisms were prepared under the same reaction conditions without the introduction of Ce 3 and sulfur powder.The obtained product was designated as C/In 2 O 3 HP. Sulfur(S)-doped In 2 O 3 hollow hexagonal prisms with carbon coating were also prepared under the same reaction conditions without the introduction of Ce 3 .The product obtained was designated as S-C/In 2 O HHP. Carbon-coated In 2 O 3 -CeO 2 hexagonal prisms were prepared using the same synthetic condition without the introduction of sulfur powder.The product obtained was designated as C/In 2 O 3 -CeO 2 HP. In 2 O 3 -CeO 2 hollow hexagonal prisms were prepared by annealing Ce-doped In-MIL-68 hexagonal prisms precursor in an air atmosphere at the same pyrolysis temperature.The product obtained was designated as In 2 O 3 -CeO 2 HHP. S-In 2 O 3 -CeO 2 hollow hexagonal prisms were also prepared under the same reaction conditions of S-C/In 2 O 3 -CeO 2 HHP using In 2 O 3 -CeO hollow hexagonal prisms to replace Ce-doped In-MIL-68 precursors. CeO 2 was also prepared via the following steps: First, Ce-based metal-organic framework precursor was prepared.70 mg Ce (NO 3 ) 3 6H 2 O, 60 mg of 1,4-benzenedicarboxylic acid, and 40 mL of N, N-Dimethylformamide were added in a three-necked bottle, followed by stirring for 2 min.Then, the three-necked bottle was kept at 120 C for min in an oil bath.After the reaction, the product was washed with ethanol several times.Finally, the Ce-based metal-organic framework precursor was heated to 500 C and kept for 2 h with a heating rate of 5 C min -1 in air atmosphere. S-C/CeO 2 was also prepared by annealing the Ce-based metal--organic framework precursor at 500 C for 2 h an N 2 atmosphere in the presence of Sulfur powder. The morphology and structurs were examined by Sigma 500 scanning electron microscope (SEM), JEM-F200 transmission electron microscopy (TEM), and SmartLab X-ray diffractometer (XRD, 9 KW, CuKa radiation).X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS) was implemented on a Kratos-AXISUL TRA DLD spectroscopy.UV-vis diffuse reflectance spectra were acquired on an Lambda 950 UV-vis spectrophotometer (Perkin-Elmer).The photoluminescence (PL) spectra were obtained on a FLS920P fluorescence system (Edinburgh).The N 2 adsorption-desorption isotherms were acquired on an ASAP 2420 adsorption apparatus micrometer.CO 2 adsorption curves were acquired on a micromeritics instrument (Autosorb-iQ, Quantachrome) at 273 K.In situ Fourier-transform infrared (FTIR) spectra were acquired from infrared spectrometer (Nicolet IS-50) with an in situ Harrick IR cell.CO temperature-programmed desorption tests were performed on an automated chemisorption analyzer (ChemBET Pulsar Quantachrome) with a thermal conductivity detector (TCD). Photocurrent response, electrochemical impedance, and Mott-Schottky plots were obtained on a BAS100B electrochemical workstation in the 0.1 M Na 2 SO 4 electrolyte solution under illumination of a 300 W Xe lamp with an AM 1.5 filter.Saturated calomel electrode and Platinum wire were used as the reference electrode and counter electrode, respectively.
